issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: regression. See https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Launch+Instance+Wizard for what should be displaying.

attachment.filename: block device mapping in Summary only on Advanced tab.png

fields.summary: BDM info no longer displaying in summary area of wizards.

comments.body: Looking at the templates, we never did show the BDM in the launch instance or launch config wizards (since 4.0). Probably not a regression as much as something that was overlooked.
Regression from 3.x
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1584

Block device mapping now appears in the Summary, but only when the user selects certain images (like wont-boot) and goes to the Advanced tab. The user has to do nothing on the Advanced tab for block device mapping to appear in the Summary.

[~dkavanagh], [~ashamblin] thought you might have some helpful insights.

[~dkavanagh], when does the block device mapping take place? Does it happen when the user selects an image?

Can we display block device mapping in the Summary without requiring the user to go to the Advanced tab? When?

Block device mapping appears in Summary (see attachment), but only when user goes to the Advanced tab.

Can we show block device mapping earlier in the wizard, like when the user selects an image?

[~lnajjar], BDM *should* only appear when the user goes to the advanced tab, since that is the point at which they are configured. You only see BDM in the advanced tab when the image selected has an EBS root device.

Well, that seems confusing. The user does nothing (no selections, no Submit) on the Advanced tab and gets block device mapping.

[~jloza], should the user have to submit the default selections that configure block device mapping on the Advanced tab?
No, but they should add additional block devices other than the root one.
OK, [~jloza]. Since you wrote "should" rather than "must," is this ticket fixed? The block display mapping info now appears in the Summary area.

It should only appear when they add additional mappings. If it does, then yes, this is fixed. If they have not added additional mappings, this is not fixed. 

If you find the wording confusing, you could change it to something like "Additional storage configured" or something else. Just update the wireframe if you do.

[~ashamblin], as @jmolo wrote above, will you please change the logic so the message appears in the Summary area only when the user adds additional mappings?

Also, will you please change the message from "Block device mapping configured" to "Additional storage configured?"

[~dkavanagh]'s note above suggests that this change applies to the "Launch Configuration" wizard, too.

Note: As requested, I changed the launch instance mockup to display "Additional storage configured."
Lawrence, please retest.  Also, see the mapping field in the form update to reflect the next available device while adding devices.

[~ashamblin], things don't look quite right. As you can see in the two "Launch instance" attachments:

1. I did not select any additional storage options but "Additional storage configured" appears in the Summary area.

2. Instead of only displaying one message, both the "Monitoring enabled" and "Additional storage configured" messages appear. In the Comments, it looks like [~jloza] wanted "Additional storage configured" to replace "Monitoring enabled."
[~lamas]I think you're right about point #1, but not about #2.  Monitoring Enabled is entirely different than Additional Storage.  Additional storage replaces Block devices...
I concur. Monitoring and BDM are separate features of the instance or launch config. You have to display those independently.
Retested on both instances where block devices may be configured and those where they may not.

Verified on Macintosh running Chrome Version 45.0.2454.93 (64-bit), Firefox 40.0.3, and Safari 8.0.8.

Thanks for being so persistent, [~ashamblin].

UX review passed. Ready for code review.
PR 1584 merged

[~ashamblin], it looks all of us focused on the launch new instance wizard. I may be wrong, but it looks like the "Create New Launch Configuration" wizard needs the fix, too (see "Launch configuration wizard" attachment).
I concur.

No worries. I created GUI-2143 Need to Show "Additional storage configured" in Create New Launch Configuration wizard: 

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-2143

Should assign to [~ashamblin] because he worked on GUI-2017.

when adding any additional volumes to an instance in the launch wizard, the "Additional storage configured" indication appears in the Summary area.
